text: What role did electricity play in the transformation of cities in the late 19th century?
options: It helped power factories and industries.
It improved communication between cities.
It allowed cities to be safer and more accessible at night.
It reduced the cost of living in urban areas.
correctAnswer: It allowed cities to be safer and more accessible at night.

text: How did electric trams and trains impact urban life during this period?
options: They allowed people to travel greater distances for work and leisure.
They caused a rise in traffic congestion.
They replaced horse-drawn carriages entirely.
They were mostly used for transporting goods.
correctAnswer: They allowed people to travel greater distances for work and leisure.

text: What enabled the construction of the first skyscrapers?
options: Advancements in glass manufacturing
The use of electric-powered elevators
The development of steel structures
Increased population growth in cities

text: What challenge arose as cities became more densely populated?
options: Electricity became less reliable.
Housing became overcrowded and living conditions worsened.
There were fewer jobs available in cities.
Transportation systems became obsolete.
correctAnswer: Housing became overcrowded and living conditions worsened.

text: Which of the following was a common health concern in growing cities during this time?
options: Malaria
Cholera and tuberculosis
Asthma
Diabetes

text: How did governments respond to the public health challenges in cities?
options: They reduced population growth by encouraging migration.
They built better roads and improved sanitation systems.
They enforced stricter building regulations.
They introduced electric street cleaning machines.
correctAnswer: They built better roads and improved sanitation systems.

text: What purpose did public parks serve in growing cities?
options: They improved air quality and provided recreational spaces.
They were used to grow food for urban populations.
They helped reduce housing costs in nearby areas.
They provided space for commercial markets.
correctAnswer: They improved air quality and provided recreational spaces.

text: What foundation was laid by the changes that took place in cities in the late 19th century?
options: The foundation for suburban development
The foundation for modern cities with evolving infrastructure and services
The foundation for increased industrialization
The foundation for decentralized rural communities
correctAnswer: The foundation for modern cities with evolving infrastructure and services
